intro: Godetia arcuata, commonly known as the curlleaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and slightly curled, giving it its common name. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in prairies and along roadsides.
